subject: NCAA Basketball Tournament
Draft and Recruitment (Sports)
lead_paragraph: The Kansas star Mario Chalmers was one of several big-name players who declared themselves eligible for the N.B.A. draft Wednesday. Chalmers did not sign with an agent, leaving open the possibility of a return to the Jayhawks. Chalmers, a junior, said he would come out only if it looked as if he would be picked in the first round. Chalmers hit the game-tying 3-pointer that forced overtime in Kansas’ victory over Memphis in the N.C.A.A. championship game.
